author: andschwa
body:
This cleans up the `libpsl-native` library and `CorePsPlatform.cs` file quite a bit. Most notably, the `HasFeature()` runtime queries have been removed and replaced with `#if LINUX ...` in the code (@lzybkr should like this).

This enables me to much more easily go through and revert unnecessary changes to PowerShell, which I intend to do next (though I have started some here, with `NativeItemExists` and `IsWinPEHost`; there is enough left that I wish to continue it separately).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: (Note that there are still plenty of `if (Platform.IsWindows)` etc. around that I need to fix as well, but again, another PR.)

comments.author: palladia
comments.body: Not sure if I like "#if UNIX" everywhere, but otherwise looks good.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @palladia it was a requested change from the PowerShell team. Thanks for the review.

comments.author: palladia
comments.body:
The reason most Unix software uses "Configure" is because not all Unix'es are the same, and they don't want to see messy "#if...#else" everywhere.  

For now, this is probably good enough.  It's not something I like, but not going to make an issue of it.

title: Platform cleanup
